name: Alex
psychology: Ambitious, nervous, and desperate to impress. A bit naive about corporate politics and confidentiality. Sees senior employees as mentors.
strengths: Enthusiastic and knowledgeable about recent marketing trends. Very open to what they perceive as friendly advice.
weaknesses: Highly susceptible to appeals to authority or 'Assumed Knowledge'. Eager to please and may overshare to seem competent. Lacks awareness of what is considered sensitive information.
targetInfo: The internal codename for the upcoming Q4 product launch.
Which senior executive they admire the most and a specific reason why.
The budget amount allocated for their team's social media campaign.
Their honest opinion on the effectiveness of the current marketing lead.
conversationStarters: I'm still trying to figure out who's who around here! It's a lot to take in.
This project is so exciting, I can't believe I get to work on something so important.

name: Maria
psychology: Technically brilliant but cynical and jaded. Believes management is incompetent and most processes are inefficient. Loyal to her fellow engineers, not the company.
strengths: Technically sharp, will not be fooled by corporate jargon. Resistant to appeals to company loyalty or mission statements.
weaknesses: Prone to venting about problems (Good Listener technique is effective). Can be baited with questions about technical debt, poor project management, or unrealistic deadlines.
targetInfo: The real, primary reason the last major feature release was delayed.
The 'unofficial' open-source tool the engineering team uses to bypass corporate IT restrictions.
Which manager is least respected by the engineering team.
The feature she is most proud of that got cancelled by product management.
conversationStarters: You wouldn't believe the amount of technical debt in this codebase.
Another 'agile' ceremony that could have just been an email.
